FuncDef:
The clock bits output-threshold command configures a threshold for the SSM level of clock signals sent by the BITS interface.
The default threshold is dnu.
By default, the threshold is dnu.
CLIs: clock bits output-threshold { prc | ssua | ssub | sec | dnu }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the SSM level is PRC (G.811 clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUA (G.812 transit node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUB (G.812 local node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SEC.
-

Indicates that the SSM level is not used for clock synchronization.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is used to configure a threshold for the SSM level of clock signals sent by BITS interfaces. When the SSM level of clock signals sent by BITS interfaces is lower than the configured threshold, the NE40E blocks the BITS interfaces from sending clock signals and generates an alarm. In this manner, the NE40E blocks the BITS interfaces from sending clock signals with poor quality.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
